one_reviews_text:
It doesn't start. It doesn't stream and i cannot select to download the clip either.

UPDATE 04/12/2019 : After many tries, I tried it again today and it works fine. Seems they fixed it. I raise my rate to 3 stars.

So the story & Artwork are obviously very nice but even when downloaded to a quality SSD, it plays extremely poorly. It's suposedly in 2160p but i dont thimk that this resolution works well on Rift? Something definitely isn't right, it's very blurry & stuttery. I presume it's been ported from Oculus Go? A real shame, could have been much better if properly optimised for Rift. The Devs should watch "The Bond" (FREE on the Oculus store) to see how it should be done.
review_feedback:
Hi Leo

Sorry for the inconvenience. Did you use Oculus go? Do you mind to send more info to support@veer.tv? We will refund you if we failed to solve the problem.

one_reviews_text: I think I was expecting something more than just a hi-res video, albeit beautiful and enjoyable to watch.  It took a moment or two to figure out where the action was as I often found myself looking in the wrong direction and so often missed things (although I suppose you can just go back and see it again).  I bought this in the sale and so it only cost £1.49 therefore I am not going to complain too much.  It is what it is... a visually pleasing 'experience' in a video format.
review_feedback: Hi there, thank you for your review. If you are interested in the story background and interested in more content on VeeR, you can join the VeeR VR world group on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/groups/1926977557324800/). You will have lot of joy there.
